required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Canakinumab in Patients With Active Hyper-IgD Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multicenter, Efficacy and Safety Pilot Study of 6-month Canakinumab Treatment With up to 6-month Follow-up in Patients With Active Hyper-IgD Syndrome (HIDS)

brief_summary.textblock: This pilot study is designed to evaluate the efficacy, the safety, and the pharmacokinetics (PK) / pharmacodynamics (PD) of canakinumab treatment in patients with HIDS.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Flares Per Participant During Historical Period and Treatment Period
primary_outcome.time_frame: Historical period, Month 6 (End of treatment period)
primary_outcome.description: A flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a C-reactive protein (CRP) value > 10 mg/L. Flares during a historical period were defined as most recent 6-months in which the participant has not received treatment for their HIDS other than symptomatic treatment with NSAIDs and/or corticosteroids.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Flares Per Participant at During Treatment Period and 24 Month Extension Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 36 (End of Long term treatment Period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: A flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a CRP value > 10 mg/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Flared at Month 6, Month 24 and Month 36
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: A flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a CRP value > 10 mg/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Flare Events Based on Physician Assessed HIDS Flare Severity Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Any flare event [Baseline up to Month 36 (End of long term treatment period 2)]
secondary_outcome.description: Physician global assessment of severity of HIDS after each flare was based on HIDS flare severity score, a 5- point scale: 0 = Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3= Moderate; 4 = Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Flare Events Based on Participant Assessed HIDS Flare Severity Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's global assessment of severity of HIDS after each flare was based on HIDS flare severity score, a 5-point scale: 0 = Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3= Moderate; 4 = Severe. Same investigator assessed the same participant throughout the study to ensure consistency between assessments. Investigators reviewed every participant's diary at each visit after their own clinical assessment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Defined Grades of Participants Assessed Symptom Control
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were assessed by participants/parent (participants aged 6-18 years) for control of signs and symptoms associated with HIDS based on 5-point scale: 0 = No control; 1 = Poor control; 2 = Somewhat control; 3 = Good control; and 4= Excellent control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Defined Grades of Physician Assessed Symptom Control
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were assessed by physician for control of signs and symptoms associated with HIDS based on 5-point scale: 0 = No control; 1 = Poor control; 2 = Somewhat control; 3 = Good control; and 4= Excellent control.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Fever as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Fever severity was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Apthus Ulcers as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Apthus ulcers were assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Lymphadenopathy as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Lymphadenopathy severity was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Abdominal Pain as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Abdominal pain was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Resolution of the Initial Flare After First Canakinumab Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Baseline), Day 28
secondary_outcome.description: Time to resolution of the initial flare after first dose of canakinumab was determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Inflammation Markers Over Time up to Month 24
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: The C-reactive Protein (CRP) and/or Serum amyloid A protein (SAA) were used as inflammatory markers. The normal range of CRP was 0-10 mg/L.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Global Score in Adults Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were assessed for health-related quality of life (HRQoL) based on Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ). HAQ was an eight 8 categories questionnaire representing all activities related to physical function. Each category has various sub-categories, which were rated by the participants on a 4- point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do. The total score was the mean of the 8 scores, and ranged from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).

secondary_outcome.measure: Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ) Global Score in Children Over Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants or their parents (participants aged 6 to 17 years) were assessed for HRQoL based on Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ). CHAQ was an eight domain questionnaire representing functional capacity and independence, evaluated for previous week. Each domain was rated on a 4-point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do.The total score is the mean from the 8 scores, and ranges from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Received Dose Up-titration During 6-month Treatment Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Month 6 (End of follow up)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 and received an escalated dose of 450 mg of canakinumab every 6 weeks thereafter starting at Week 6 were determined.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Flares Experienced During the Study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
secondary_outcome.description: Flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a CRP value > 10 mg/L. The change in post canakinumab treatment flare duration during the study were assessed as compared to historical period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Flare After the Last Dose of Canakinumab During the Follow-up Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Last dose of canakinumab treatment in follow-up period to end of follow-up period (Day 337)
secondary_outcome.description: The median time to flare by the participants after administration of the last dose of canakinumab during the follow-up period was analysed using Kaplan-Meier method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Start of study treatment) up to Month 36 (End of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) were defined as any unfavorable and unintended diagnosis, symptom, sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), syndrome or disease which either occurs during study, having been absent at baseline, or, if present at baseline, appears to worsen. Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalisation, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.

secondary_outcome.measure: Participants Who Received Rescue Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 36 (End of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Participants who experienced flares were treated with corticosteroids and NSAIDs as rescue medication.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Concentration-time Profile of Canakinumab
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose), Day 4, Day 15, Day 43, Day 85, Day 127, Day 169 (End of treatment period), Day 197, Day 225, Day 253, Day 281, Day 309, and Day 337 (End of follow-up period) (Post-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Canakinumab concentrations in serum were assessed for evaluating pharmacokinetics (PK) of the drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Concentration of Total Interleukin-1β Antibody (IL-1β)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose), Day 4, Day 15, Day 43, Day 85, Day 127, Day 169 (End of treatment period), Day 197, Day 225, Day 253, Day 281, Day 309, and Day 337 (End of follow-up period) (Post-dose)
secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacodynamics of canakinumab was assessed by total IL-1β (sum of free and bound canakinumab) concentration, determined in serum by means of sandwich ELISA assay with limit of detection at 0.1 picogram/millilitre.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Exhibiting Anti-canakinumab Antibodies at Any Visit
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 36 (End of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Immunogenicity assessment included determination of anti-canakinumab (ACZ885) antibodies in serum samples using bridging ECLIA assay.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with a diagnosis of HIDS proven by DNA analysis and/or enzymatic studies.
2. At time of start of drug treatment: active HIDS as evidenced by a physician global assessment of HIDS flare severity ≥ 2 and CRP values >10 mg/L (normal CRP < or = 10 mg/L).
3. Patients who have a history of > or = 3 febrile acute HIDS flares in a 6-month period when not receiving prophylaxis treatment (e.g. anakinra daily treatment) with a duration of each flare lasting > or = 4 days and limiting the normal daily activities.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Pregnant or nursing (lactating) women.
2. History of being immunocompromised, including a positive HIV at screening (ELISA and Western blot) test result.
3. Positive Hepatitis B or Hepatitis C.
4. Live vaccinations within 3 months prior to the start of the trial
5. Positive tuberculosis screening test.
Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The study was conducted at 3 centres in Spain.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 10 participants were screened, 9 of which entered in the treatment period of the study, one participant was considered to be a screening failure.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new Hyper-IgD with periodic fever syndrome (HIDS) flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Lack of compliance to study procedures

baseline.population: The analysis was performed in the Full Analysis Set (FAS), defined as all participants who received at least one application of study treatment and had at least one post-baseline assessment for primary efficacy variable.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

outcome.description: Lymphadenopathy severity was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Lymphadenopathy as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
measure.description: Lymphadenopathy severity was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Experiencing Abdominal Pain as Assessed by Physician's Global Assessment
measure.description: Abdominal pain was assessed by physician after each flare using a 5-point scale: 0 =Absent signs/symptoms; 1 = Minimal signs/symptoms; 2 = Mild; 3 = Moderate; 4 = Severe.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group, respectively.

outcome.title: Time to Resolution of the Initial Flare After First Canakinumab Treatment
outcome.description: Time to resolution of the initial flare after first dose of canakinumab was determined.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Baseline), Day 28
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Time to Resolution of the Initial Flare After First Canakinumab Treatment
measure.description: Time to resolution of the initial flare after first dose of canakinumab was determined.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Inflammation Markers Over Time up to Month 24
outcome.description: The C-reactive Protein (CRP) and/or Serum amyloid A protein (SAA) were used as inflammatory markers. The normal range of CRP was 0-10 mg/L.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Inflammation Markers Over Time up to Month 24
measure.description: The C-reactive Protein (CRP) and/or Serum amyloid A protein (SAA) were used as inflammatory markers. The normal range of CRP was 0-10 mg/L.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Global Score in Adults Over Time
outcome.description: Participants were assessed for health-related quality of life (HRQoL) based on Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ). HAQ was an eight 8 categories questionnaire representing all activities related to physical function. Each category has various sub-categories, which were rated by the participants on a 4- point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do. The total score was the mean of the 8 scores, and ranged from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively. Here "Number of participants analyzed" signifies the participants assessed for HAQ during study.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ) Global Score in Adults Over Time
measure.description: Participants were assessed for health-related quality of life (HRQoL) based on Health Assessment Questionnaire (HAQ). HAQ was an eight 8 categories questionnaire representing all activities related to physical function. Each category has various sub-categories, which were rated by the participants on a 4- point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do. The total score was the mean of the 8 scores, and ranged from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively. Here "Number of participants analyzed" signifies the participants assessed for HAQ during study.

outcome.title: Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ) Global Score in Children Over Time
outcome.description: Participants or their parents (participants aged 6 to 17 years) were assessed for HRQoL based on Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ). CHAQ was an eight domain questionnaire representing functional capacity and independence, evaluated for previous week. Each domain was rated on a 4-point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do.The total score is the mean from the 8 scores, and ranges from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively. Here "Number of participants analyzed" signifies the participants assessed for CHAQ during study.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ) Global Score in Children Over Time
measure.description: Participants or their parents (participants aged 6 to 17 years) were assessed for HRQoL based on Childhood Health Assessment Questionnaire (CHAQ). CHAQ was an eight domain questionnaire representing functional capacity and independence, evaluated for previous week. Each domain was rated on a 4-point difficulty scale: 0 = any difficulty; 1 = some difficulty; 2 = much difficulty; 3 = unable to do.The total score is the mean from the 8 scores, and ranges from 0 (no disability) to 3 (completely disabled).
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively. Here "Number of participants analyzed" signifies the participants assessed for CHAQ during study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Received Dose Up-titration During 6-month Treatment Period
outcome.description: Participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 and received an escalated dose of 450 mg of canakinumab every 6 weeks thereafter starting at Week 6 were determined.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 up to Month 6 (End of follow up)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Who Received Dose Up-titration During 6-month Treatment Period
measure.description: Participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 and received an escalated dose of 450 mg of canakinumab every 6 weeks thereafter starting at Week 6 were determined.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population.

outcome.title: Duration of Flares Experienced During the Study
outcome.description: Flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a CRP value > 10 mg/L. The change in post canakinumab treatment flare duration during the study were assessed as compared to historical period.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Month 6 (End of treatment period), Month 12 (End of follow up period), Month 24 (End of Long term treatment period 1) and Month 36 (End of Long term treatment period 2)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Duration of Flares Experienced During the Study
measure.description: Flare was defined as Physician Global Assessment of HIDS flare severity score of ≥ 2 and a CRP value > 10 mg/L. The change in post canakinumab treatment flare duration during the study were assessed as compared to historical period.
measure.population: The analysis was performed in the FAS population. The 'n' signifies those participants evaluable for this measure at specified time points for each group respectively.

outcome.title: Time to Flare After the Last Dose of Canakinumab During the Follow-up Period
outcome.description: The median time to flare by the participants after administration of the last dose of canakinumab during the follow-up period was analysed using Kaplan-Meier method.
outcome.time_frame: Last dose of canakinumab treatment in follow-up period to end of follow-up period (Day 337)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population. Here "Number of participants analysed" signifies the participants assessed for time to flare after the last dose of canakinumab during follow-up period.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Time to Flare After the Last Dose of Canakinumab During the Follow-up Period
measure.description: The median time to flare by the participants after administration of the last dose of canakinumab during the follow-up period was analysed using Kaplan-Meier method.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population. Here "Number of participants analysed" signifies the participants assessed for time to flare after the last dose of canakinumab during follow-up period.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Adverse events (AEs) were defined as any unfavorable and unintended diagnosis, symptom, sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), syndrome or disease which either occurs during study, having been absent at baseline, or, if present at baseline, appears to worsen. Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalisation, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Start of study treatment) up to Month 36 (End of study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on Safety Set (SAF) population defined as all participants who received at least one application of study treatment and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Adverse events (AEs) were defined as any unfavorable and unintended diagnosis, symptom, sign (including an abnormal laboratory finding), syndrome or disease which either occurs during study, having been absent at baseline, or, if present at baseline, appears to worsen. Serious adverse events (SAEs) were defined as any untoward medical occurrences that result in death, are life threatening, require (or prolong) hospitalisation, cause persistent or significant disability/incapacity, result in congenital anomalies or birth defects, or are other conditions which in judgement of investigators represent significant hazards.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on Safety Set (SAF) population defined as all participants who received at least one application of study treatment and had at least one post-baseline safety assessment.

outcome.title: Participants Who Received Rescue Treatment
outcome.description: Participants who experienced flares were treated with corticosteroids and NSAIDs as rescue medication.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 36 (End of study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Participants Who Received Rescue Treatment
measure.description: Participants who experienced flares were treated with corticosteroids and NSAIDs as rescue medication.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

outcome.title: Serum Concentration-time Profile of Canakinumab
outcome.description: Canakinumab concentrations in serum were assessed for evaluating pharmacokinetics (PK) of the drug.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose), Day 4, Day 15, Day 43, Day 85, Day 127, Day 169 (End of treatment period), Day 197, Day 225, Day 253, Day 281, Day 309, and Day 337 (End of follow-up period) (Post-dose)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Serum Concentration-time Profile of Canakinumab
measure.description: Canakinumab concentrations in serum were assessed for evaluating pharmacokinetics (PK) of the drug.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

outcome.title: Serum Concentration of Total Interleukin-1β Antibody (IL-1β)
outcome.description: Pharmacodynamics of canakinumab was assessed by total IL-1β (sum of free and bound canakinumab) concentration, determined in serum by means of sandwich ELISA assay with limit of detection at 0.1 picogram/millilitre.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Pre-dose), Day 4, Day 15, Day 43, Day 85, Day 127, Day 169 (End of treatment period), Day 197, Day 225, Day 253, Day 281, Day 309, and Day 337 (End of follow-up period) (Post-dose)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Serum Concentration of Total Interleukin-1β Antibody (IL-1β)
measure.description: Pharmacodynamics of canakinumab was assessed by total IL-1β (sum of free and bound canakinumab) concentration, determined in serum by means of sandwich ELISA assay with limit of detection at 0.1 picogram/millilitre.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Exhibiting Anti-canakinumab Antibodies at Any Visit
outcome.description: Immunogenicity assessment included determination of anti-canakinumab (ACZ885) antibodies in serum samples using bridging ECLIA assay.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to Month 36 (End of study)
outcome.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator's discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

measure.title: Number of Participants Exhibiting Anti-canakinumab Antibodies at Any Visit
measure.description: Immunogenicity assessment included determination of anti-canakinumab (ACZ885) antibodies in serum samples using bridging ECLIA assay.
measure.population: The analysis was performed on the FAS population.

reported_events.time_frame: Serious Adverse Events are monitored from date of First Participant First Visit (FPFV) until Last Participant Last Visit (LPLV). All other adverse events are monitored from First Participant First Treatment until LPLV.

group.title: Canakinumab
group.description: Participants received body weight stratified dosage of canakinumab (4 mg/kg for participants less than or equal to (≤) 40 kg or 300 mg for participants more than (>) 40 kg) as starting dose s.c. injection every 6 weeks during 6 months of treatment. The dose was escalated to additional 150 mg (2 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) dose at the moment of flare, and 450 mg (6 mg/kg for participants ≤40 kg) every 6 weeks, thereafter starting at Week 6 in participants who experienced a new HIDS flare between baseline and Week 4 as per investigator’s discretion. If the flare occurred between Weeks 5-6, the participants received rescue medication and waited up to Week 6 to receive a total of 450 mg of canakinumab.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The terms and conditions of Novartis' agreements with its investigators may vary. However, Novartis does not prohibit any investigator from publishing. Any publications from a single site are postponed until the publication of the pooled data (i.e, data from all sites) in the clinical trial.
